translation: zszokowany, przerażony [suddenly filled with strong feelings of shock and worry]
sentence: He stood aghast at the sight of so much blood.

translation: poprzednik, okoliczność poprzedzająca [formal; a thing or an event that exists or comes before another, and may have influenced it]
sentence: The book dealt with the historical antecedents of the Civil War.

translation: okrucieństwo, nieludzkość [an extremely cruel, violent, or shocking act]
sentence: They are on trial for committing atrocities against the civilian population.

translation: powiększać, pomnażać [formal; to increase the size or value of something by adding something to it]
sentence: He would have to find work to augment his income.

translation: pożytek, korzyść [use, purpose, advantage, or profit]
sentence: We tried to persuade her not to resign, but to no avail.

translation: pęcherz, bąbel [a painful swelling on the skin that contains liquid, caused usually by continuous rubbing, especially on your foot, or by burning]
sentence: New shoes always give me blisters.

translation: hulać [literary or humorous; to enjoy yourself by drinking alcohol and speaking and laughing loudly in a group of people]
sentence: We'd been up carousing till the early hours and were exhausted.

translation: przekonanie, pewność [formal; a feeling of being certain; a thing about which you are certain]
sentence: It is impossible to predict the outcome of the negotiations with any degree of certitude.

translation: niezdarny [(of people and animals) moving or doing things in a very awkward way]
sentence: I spilled your coffee. Sorry—that was clumsy of me.

translation: sympatyczny, miły, przyjemny [formal; (of a person) pleasant to spend time with because their interests and character are similar to your own]
sentence: We spent a relaxed evening with congenial friends.

translation: pożądliwy, chciwy, zazdrosny [formal disapproving; wanting to have something too much, especially something that belongs to someone else]
sentence: I can't help casting covetous looks at my neighbour's new Porsche.

translation: tchórzostwo [fear or lack of courage]
sentence: The lieutenant had displayed cowardice in the face of the enemy.

translation: surowy, w stanie surowym [simple and not very accurate but giving a general idea of something; simple and not skilfully done or made]
sentence: In crude terms, the causes of mental illness seem to be of three main kinds.

translation: wilgotny [slightly wet, especially in a way that is not pleasant or comfortable]
sentence: This shirt still feels a bit damp.

translation: ociągać się, mitrężyć [to do something or go somewhere very slowly, taking more time than is necessary]
sentence: Stop dawdling! We're going to be late!

translation: bóstwo [a god or goddess]
sentence: Ares and Aphrodite were the ancient Greek deities of war and love.

translation: potop, powódź [a very large amount of rain or water]
sentence: This little stream can become a deluge when it rains heavily.

translation: drwina, szyderstwo [formal; the situation in which someone or something is laughed at and considered stupid or of no value]
sentence: They treated his suggestion with derision.

translation: wymyślać, obmyślać [to invent a plan, system, object, etc., usually using your intelligence or imagination]
sentence: He's good at devising language games that you can play with students in class.

translation: dostojny, godny [controlled, serious, and calm, and therefore deserving respect]
sentence: He has maintained a dignified silence about the rumours.

translation: nieprzychylność, niełaska [the feeling that you do not like or approve of someone or something]
sentence: They looked upon the birth of a girl with disfavor.

translation: edykt, rozporządzenie [formal; an official order, especially one that is given in a forceful and unfair way]
sentence: The City Council issued an edict against spitting in the street.

translation: bulwersować, doprowadzać do wściekłości [to make someone very annoyed, usually when they can do nothing to solve a problem]
sentence: His assistant’s carelessness is exasperating him.

translation: ucieczka [(an act or example of) escape, running away, or avoiding something]
sentence: They lost all their possessions during their flight from the invading army.

translation: lekceważący, nonszalancki [not serious about a serious subject, in an attempt to be funny or to appear clever]
sentence: It's easy to be flippant, but we have a serious problem to deal with here.

translation: trzoda [a group of sheep, goats, or birds]
sentence: The shepherd is bringing his flock down from the hills.

translation: palec wskazujący [the finger next to the thumb]
sentence: He held a tiny seed between his thumb and forefinger.

translation: odtąd [formal; starting from this time]
sentence: Henceforth, the said building shall be the property of Brendan Duggan.

translation: nieubłagany, nieustępliwy [formal; used to describe (someone who has) strong opinions or feelings that are impossible to change]
sentence: Even after being offered a free gift card, the angry customer remained implacable.

translation: motywować, zachęcać [to encourage someone to behave in a particular way by offering them a reward]
sentence: You need to incentivize your existing customers to stay with you.

translation: niezliczone, bez liku [too many to be counted]
sentence: The project has been delayed by innumerable problems.

translation: o tyle na ile [formal; to the degree that]
sentence: She had done her best to comfort him, insofar as she was able.

translation: izolować [to cover something with a special material so that heat, electricity, or sound cannot escape through it]
sentence: Some parents want to insulate their children from real life.

translation: niezwyciężony [impossible to defeat or prevent from doing what is intended]
sentence: Last year the company seemed invincible but in recent weeks has begun to have problems.

translation: smalec [a white substance made from pig fat and used in cooking]
sentence: We cannot get enough lard to replace compound cooking fat entirely.

translation: biczowanie [the punishment of being hit with a whip]
sentence: He was sentenced to receive a lashing.

translation: przezroczysty [clearly expressed and easily understood; literary; clear and transparent]
sentence: His prose style is flexible, limpid, and a great pleasure to read.

translation: długowieczność [formal; living for a long time]
sentence: To what do you attribute your longevity?

translation: prostak, cham [informal; a young man who behaves in a very rude, offensive, and sometimes violent way]
sentence: Teenage louts roam the streets at night.

translation: pasożyt [an animal or plant that lives on or in another animal or plant of a different type and feeds from it]
sentence: The older drugs didn't deal effectively with the malaria parasite.

translation: chłop, wieśniak [(especially in the past, or in poorer countries) a farmer who owns or rents a small piece of land]
sentence: Tons of internationally donated food was distributed to the starving peasants.

translation: przesiąknąć, przeniknąć [formal; to spread through something and be present in every part of it]
sentence: A foul smell of stale beer permeated the whole building.

translation: owładnąć, przeniknąć [to spread through and be noticeable in every part of something]
sentence: The film movie is a reflection of the violence that pervades our culture.

translation: chlew [an enclosed area where pigs are kept; a dirty or messy place]
sentence: Your bedroom's a pigsty!

translation: powód [law; someone who makes a legal complaint against someone else in court]
sentence: The court upheld the plaintiff's claim for damages.

translation: przyrzeczenie [a serious or formal promise, especially one to give money or to be a friend, or something that you give as a sign that you will keep a promise]
sentence: All the candidates have given pledges not to raise taxes if they are elected.

translation: społeczność (też: pospólstwo) [the ordinary people who live in a particular country or place]
sentence: Some studies show that workers in the nuclear industry are more likely than the general populace to get cancer.

translation: przesłanka [an idea or theory on which a statement or action is based]
sentence: They had started with the premise that all men are created equal.

translation: arogancki, zbyt pewny siebie [too confident, in a way that shows a lack of respect for other people]
sentence: It would be presumptuous of me to comment on the matter.

translation: głęboki, dogłębny [felt or experienced very strongly or in an extreme way]
sentence: His mother's death when he was aged six had a very profound effect on him.

translation: ranga [a position in an organization, such as the army, showing the importance of the person having it]
sentence: He has just been promoted to the rank of captain.

translation: wykonanie, interpretacja [a particular way of performing a song, piece of music, or poem]
sentence: The band gave a live rendition of their latest single.

translation: odtwarzać [to go back over something, for example a path or a series of past actions]
sentence: When he realized he had lost his keys, he retraced in his mind his movements that day.

translation: błąkać się, wędrować [to move or travel around an area, especially a large one]
sentence: He spent most of his life roving the world in search of his fortune.

translation: stateczny, spokojny [avoiding excitement or great activity and usually calm and relaxed]
sentence: The fight against a chemical storage site has transformed a normally sedate village into a battleground.

translation: sen [literary; sleep; a time when someone is asleep]
sentence: The phone suddenly roused her from slumber.

translation: uroczysty, poważny [(of a person) not happy or smiling]
sentence: Her face grew solemn.

translation: całkiem mokry, przemoczony [informal; extremely wet]
sentence: You're sopping wet - go and get changed.

translation: bełkotać, mówić niezrozumiałe wyrazy [to speak quickly and with difficulty, making soft spitting sounds, because you are angry or embarrassed]
sentence: He sputtered an apology about being 14 minutes late.

translation: podskórny [medical; existing under the skin]
sentence: Subcutaneous tissue has few blood vessels and so drugs injected here are for slow, sustained rates of absorption.

translation: okop, rów [a deep hole dug by soldiers and used as a place from which they can attack the enemy while being hidden; a narrow hole that is dug into the ground]
sentence: A workman was killed when the sides of the trench he was working in collapsed.

translation: pstrąg [a fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs, that is a popular food]
sentence: The lake is famous for its trout fishing.

translation: ukłucie [a sudden short feeling of physical or mental pain]
sentence: I admit I felt a twinge of guilt as we left. I felt a twinge in my knee.

translation: nieprawdopodobny, niesamowity [strange or mysterious; difficult or impossible to explain]
sentence: He has an uncanny ability to pick a winner.

translation: przewrócić do góry nogami [to push or move something so that the part that usually touches the ground is not touching the ground any more]
sentence: She upended the chessboard halfway through the game because she was losing.

translation: przebaczalny, lekki [formal; (of a sin or mistake) not very serious and therefore able to be forgiven]
sentence: A venial sin, for you acted without evil intention.

translation: zmienne koleje losu [formal; changes that happen at different times during the life or development of someone or something, especially those that result in conditions being worse]
sentence: Losing your job is just one of the vicissitudes of life.

translation: plik [a thick pile of pieces of paper, paper money, etc. folded or rolled together]
sentence: He pulled a thick wad of $20 bills out of his pocket.

translation: wart zachodu [useful, important, or good enough to be a suitable reward for the money or time spent or the effort made]
sentence: She considers teaching a worthwhile career.

translation: gniew [literary; extreme anger]
sentence: The people feared the wrath of God.
